dict.string:
H19/IGF2 This article
Role of long non-coding RNA in cells: Example of the H19/IGF2 locus
is poorly written (makes me uncomfortable) but presents basic ideas pretty clearly. These figures show how imprinting controls expression of H19/IGF2 in the maternal/paternal chromosomes:
￼
￼
H19 can act as a source of microRNAs (several examples given)
More interestingly, H19 regulates IGF2 ligand and receptor expression, H19 and IGF2 are in competition for enhancers; thus H19 expression affects IGF2 (exactly how??)
More clear to me, H19 also regulates IGF2 in trans - it is a negative regulator (need to understand mechanism). ALSO, H19 is source of miRNA mir-675-3p, which negatively regulates IGF receptor.
Claim that after both, H19 repressed in all tissues except skeletal muscle - so must be pathological in eye?
H19 is precursor for two miRNAs, mir-675-3p and mir-675-5p. The latter represses retinoblastoma .
Interaction between H19 and p53:
￼ H19
